title: Child sex offender released with 61 conditions after convincing judge he isn't a risk to children
text:
A dangerous child sex offender has been released from a West Australian jail with a record 61 parole conditions.

Paul Douglas Allen is a convicted pedophile with a history of re-offending and has convinced a judge he isn't a risk to children.

The 39-year-old had more than one million pictures of child pornography found on his computer in 2014 and had newspaper clippings of children found inside his jail cell last year.

A dangerous child sex offender has been released from a West Australian jail with a record 61 parole conditions (stock image)

The sexual predator committed twelve offences to seven victims aged between four and 10-years-old from 1998 to 2001, and is now subject to conditions in an effort to prevent him from offending again.

He is prohibited from having toys, games or lollies in public, can have no alcohol, and is not allowed to access the internet.

Allen will be under constant electronic monitoring and will be taking anti-libidinal medication in hospital for the next 10 years.

'It is the first time that I am aware of that a court has ordered chemical castration by injection,' Attorney-General of Western Australia John Quigley told 7News.

'So it's not up to the offender to take a tablet; once a month he's hauled in and given an injection.'

The Supreme Court of Western Australia deemed that the risk of releasing Allen from prison can be managed with his extreme parole conditions.
description: A dangerous child sex offender has been released from a West Australian jail with a record 61 parole conditions.
authors: Jackson Barron For Daily Mail Australia
